body_html:
From the README:

The TensorFlow Python API currently requires Python 2.7:
we are working on adding support for Python 3.0.

If you require 2.7 for the 2.X line, then why restrict yourselves to 3.0 (which was released about the time of 2.6)? If you target 3.3+, then you'll save yourselves a lot of headache, especially if you're using u'あ' unicode strings. (also see unicode_literals).

And 👍 for six for more complicated things.
body_text:
From the README:

The TensorFlow Python API currently requires Python 2.7:
we are working on adding support for Python 3.0.

If you require 2.7 for the 2.X line, then why restrict yourselves to 3.0 (which was released about the time of 2.6)? If you target 3.3+, then you'll save yourselves a lot of headache, especially if you're using u'あ' unicode strings. (also see unicode_literals).
And 👍 for six for more complicated things.
body:
From the README:

> The TensorFlow Python API currently requires Python 2.7:
> we are working on adding support for Python 3.0.

If you require 2.7 for the 2.X line, then why restrict yourselves to 3.0 (which was [released](https://www.python.org/downloads/) about the time of 2.6)? If you target 3.3+, then you'll save yourselves a lot of headache, especially if you're using `u'あ'` unicode strings. (also see [`unicode_literals`](https://docs.python.org/3.3/howto/pyporting.html#from-future-import-unicode-literals)).

And :+1: for [six](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/six) for more complicated things.
